---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
x <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Financial-Times/police-misconduct-complaints-analysis/main/output/philly_clean.csv") %>% 
  select(officer_id, po_race, po_sex)
```


```{r, clean_data}
clean_data <- x %>% 
  group_by(officer_id) %>% 
  summarise(total = n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(total))
  
```

```{r, plot_data}
clean_data %>% 
  slice(1:10) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = as.character(officer_id), y = total)) +
    geom_col() +
    coord_flip() +
    labs(title = "Complaints about Police Officers in Philadelphia",
         subtitle = "Most complained about officers have many more complaints than\nthe typical officer",
         x = NULL,
         y = "Complaints",
         caption = "Data from Financial Times")
```
